plugins.name: NavJam
plugins.description:
NavJam is a versatile navigation and utility plugin for Figma and FigJam, meticulously designed to streamline your workflow and optimize interaction with large boards.


With NavJam, you can tailor your navigation experience with three plugin sizes, ranging from simple back-and-forth navigation to the full power of a dynamic minimap.


Key Features:


Powerful Search: Quickly locate and zoom into specific components or areas of your board.

Dynamic Minimap: Get an overhead view of your entire board and navigate effortlessly with a single click.

Back and Forward Buttons: Easily navigate through your viewing history for quick access to previous focus areas.


NEW! Enhanced QR Code Generator!

Automatically populate QR code text from selected nodes or frames.

Customize with URLs, additional text, sizes, colors, and error correction levels.


NEW Logo Support: Upload and save custom logos to embed directly into your QR codes for future use, making personalization fast and easy.

Save default QR code settings for quicker reuse.

Generate, preview, and add QR codes to your canvas with a single click or double-click.

Even if the QR code isn‚Äôt for Figma/FigJam, NavJam makes generating custom QR codes a breeze for any purpose.


We'd love to hear your feedback and suggestions for new features to make NavJam even more powerful‚Äîlet us know how we can improve your experience!
plugins.tagline: Boost productivity in Figma & FigJam with advanced navigation tools, a minimap, and a search feature

plugins.name: Resizer
plugins.description:
This plugin empowers you to resize multiple layers by independently setting their width, height, and constraints. Choose between fixed values, relative adjustments to the selected layer or its parent, or select from an expanding list of presets for even more flexibility.


Features

  1. Fixed values: Set specific sizes (e.g., 200).
  2. Relative to self: Use arithmetic operations (e.g., +20, -100, 5x, 1/4) to resize layers relative to their current dimensions.
  3. Relative to parent: Resize using percentages relative to the parent container (e.g., 50%).
  4. Custom options: Tailor resizing to fit unique scenarios.
  5. Familiar presets: Quickly apply predefined size options without taking your hands off the keyboard.


Custom Options

  1. Preserve width/height: Modify only one dimension.
  2. Lock aspect ratio: Adjust size while maintaining proportions.
  3. Mirror height/width: Change the orientation or inherit the opposite parameter.
  4. Fill width/height: Instantly fill the parent container.
  5. Stretch top/right/bottom/left: Resize to touch the parent container's boundaries.
  6. Minimum/Maximum among selection: Automatically set size to the smallest or largest dimension in the selection.


Known Issues

  1. Resize behavior may be unpredictable. Let me know your expectations in the comments!
  2. Search might not return expected results if you skip characters.
  3. You cannot use 0px values due to a limitation of the Figma API.
  4. The "Learn more" action is not available, yet.
  5. Some FigJam layers do not support resizing, and since the notification system is currently minimal, these layers are ignored without clear communication through the UI.


Future plans

I‚Äôm working on these updates based on your feedback. Your support, through comments, likes, or sharing, helps make these possible!

  1. Variable support: Set dimension-scoped variables for even more flexibility.
  2. Custom presets: Define your own presets.
  3. Anchor control: Adjust resizing behavior by choosing between center, top, right, bottom, or left anchor points.
  4. Improved search: Enhance search to handle cases where characters are skipped.
  5. Improved notifications: Enhance the response clarity after resizing.
plugins.tagline: Resize multiple layers instantly with fixed, relative, or custom options.

plugins.name: Responsive Table
plugins.description:
Release Notes: Responsive Table Converter v1.0

We're excited to announce the release of the Responsive Table Converter plugin for Figma! This powerful tool allows you to transform standard web tables into mobile-friendly tables with repeated headers, making your designs more responsive and user-friendly.


Key Features:

Easy Conversion: Quickly convert web tables to mobile-optimized tables with repeated headers.

Improved Readability: Enhance the readability of tables on mobile devices.

Seamless Integration: Works directly within your Figma design workflow.

Efficient Workflow: Save time and ensure consistency in your responsive designs.

Instructions to Use Responsive Table Converter


Design Header Cells:

Create the header cells for your table.

Set a fixed width and height for each header cell.

Arrange the header cells in a horizontal auto layout.


Design Row Cells:

Create the row cells in the same manner as the header cells.

Set a fixed width and height for each row cell.

Arrange the row cells in a horizontal auto layout.


Group Header Cells:

Select all the header cells.

Group them and name the group "Head".


Group Row Cells:

Select all the row cells.

Group them and name the group "Row".


Group the Table:

Select the "Head" and "Row" groups.

Group them together and set the auto layout to vertical.


Repeat the Rows:

Duplicate the "Row" group as many times as needed to create your table rows.


Select the Frame:

Select the frame containing your table.


Use the Plugin:

Run the Responsive Table Converter plugin.

The plugin will convert your table to a mobile-friendly format with repeated header
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly transform tables for seamless mobile viewing.

Select the "Head" and "Row" groups.

Group them together and set the auto layout to vertical.


Repeat the Rows:

Duplicate the "Row" group as many times as needed to create your table rows.


Select the Frame:

Select the frame containing your table.


Use the Plugin:

Run the Responsive Table Converter plugin.

The plugin will convert your table to a mobile-friendly format with repeated header
94982.tagline: Effortlessly transform tables for seamless mobile viewing.

plugins.name: RGB Color Picker
plugins.description:
An RGB color picker is a tool that allows you to choose a color by adjusting the amount of red, green, and blue light in the mix. RGB stands for Red, Green, and Blue, which are the primary colors of light. By combining these colors in various proportions, you can create a wide range of different colors.


There are two main types of RGB color pickers:


Interactive pickers: These are digital tools that you can use on a computer or mobile device. They typically have a color wheel or sliders that you can use to adjust the red, green, and blue values. The picker will display the resulting color in real-time, allowing you to fine-tune your selection.

Predefined pickers: These are static charts or lists that display a range of RGB color values and their corresponding colors. You can select a color from the chart by finding the one that matches your desired shade.

RGB color pickers are widely used in various applications, including:


Graphic design: For selecting colors for logos, illustrations, and other visual elements.

Web design: To define the colors used for text, backgrounds, and other website elements.

Image editing: To adjust the colors in photos or create digital art.

plugins.name: Image Brightness Analyzer
plugins.description:
Enhance the readability of your images with the Brightness Analyzer plugin. This tool calculates the average brightness of any image, providing recommendations for optimal overlay use to ensure your text stands out. Whether you‚Äôre designing for web, print, or social media, this plugin helps you achieve perfect contrast for maximum legibility.


üåû Features


  1. Accurate Brightness Calculation: Uses an algorithm to determine the average brightness of your images.
  2. Overlay Recommendations: Suggests the best overlay color and opacity to improve text readability.
  3. User-Friendly Interface: Simple, intuitive design for quick and efficient use.
  4. Seamless Integration: Works flawlessly within your Figma workflow.


üöÄ Usage Instructions


  1. Upload your image to the plugin.
  2. Instantly receive the average brightness percentage.
  3. Get recommendations for the best overlay to use.
  4. Apply the suggested overlay to enhance text visibility.


Why Use Brightness Analyzer?


Ensuring your text is readable over images can be challenging. The Brightness Analyzer plugin simplifies this process by providing you with clear, actionable recommendations based on the brightness of your image. Say goodbye to guesswork and ensure your designs always have the perfect contrast.


Made with üåû by Rodolphe

plugins.name: Vector Blender
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that generates smooth transitions between two shapes by creating intermediate states.


Quick start

  1. Select the first shape
  2. Select the second shape (Please note that you don't need to multiple select)
  3. If the selected elements are supported types, you will see the indicator turn green
  4. Adjust the configuration, such as the number of elements and the layer order
  5. Generate elements


The plugin interpolates various properties including

  1. Position and size
  2. Rotation angles
  3. Fill colors and opacity
  4. Stroke colors and opacity
  5. Corner radius
  6. Vertex (for vectors)


Supported Shapes

  1. Vectors
  2. Line
  3. Rectangles
  4. Polygons
  5. Ellipses
plugins.tagline: Blend two shapes to generate smooth transitions

plugins.name: Easy QR
plugins.description:
Easy QR for Figma - Simplifying QR Code Design


Elevate your Figma experience with Easy QR, a dynamic plugin leveraging the powerful QR Code Styling library. Effortlessly generate QR codes as SVG and PNG directly within Figma, offering unparalleled flexibility and customization.


Key Features:


SVG and PNG Output: Generate QR codes in scalable SVG or high-resolution PNG formats, seamlessly integrating them into your Figma projects.


Customization Options:


  • Shapes and Colors: Modify QR code shapes and colors to align with your design aesthetic.
  • Logo Integration: Add logos to personalize QR codes, enhancing brand recognition.
  • Background Options: Choose between backgrounds or go for a clean, transparent look.
  • Correction Level: Ensure optimal scan performance by adjusting the error correction level to meet your specific requirements.


Trial Period:

Enjoy a 7-day trial of Easy QR, exploring its full range of features at no cost.


Activation:

After the trial period, a one-time payment of $10 is required to activate Easy QR. Please note that local taxes may apply to the payment.


How to Get Started:


  • Install Easy QR from the Figma plugin library.
  • Generate QR codes with ease directly within your Figma workspace.
  • Customize shapes, colors, logos, and more to suit your design needs.
  • Experience the convenience of QR code creation and modification without leaving Figma.


Enhance Your Workflow:


Whether you're designing marketing materials, product packaging, or interactive presentations, Easy QR streamlines the QR code creation process, empowering you to create visually appealing and functional designs effortlessly.


Upgrade Today:

Unlock the full potential of QR code customization with Easy QR. Try the 7-day trial and seamlessly transition to the full version with a one-time payment of $10. (Local taxes may apply.)


Note: Easy QR is designed for Figma and built on the QR Code Styling library to ensure reliability and efficiency in QR code generation.

plugins.name: Codyhouse Color Importer
plugins.description:
Import your colors from Codyhouse to Figma like never before!


Features:

This plugin can:

  • Import colors from Codyhouse: UI Framework -> Globals -> Colors
  • Create "color sample" circles from imported color
  • Split color to themes



How to use?

  1. Open Codyhouse and go to color editor (UI Framework -> Globals -> Colors).
  2. Create your color system and test this.
  3. Click to Copy SCSS
  4. Open Figma and run this plugin.
  5. Paste your SCSS code in textarea.
  6. Click to Generate Color.
  7. And "Voila!)" You have imported colors into your color schemes!


Contacts:

  • Website: jagk.ru
  • Repository: GitHub

Customizable Grid: Create a grid of frames for each wireframe component from Octopus.do, enabling you to design your own Figma wireframe blocks for future imports.

plugins.name: Design Asset ProductionÔºàDAPÔºâ
plugins.description:
Introduction:

Obtain all solid color style data with one click and save it to variables in Figma.

Main functions:

Simple and easy to use: users only need to click the button of the plug-in to complete the query and export of color styles.

Method of use:

  1. Open the Figma document.
  2. Install and run the plug-in (Design Asset Production(DAP)).
  3. Click the "colors style to Variable" button in the plug-in interface.
  4. The plug-in will automatically get the solid color style and add the name and color value to the variable.
  5. The query and export results are saved in variables in the plug-in and are available to the user at any time.

About the Author:

Hello everyone, my English name is Cheung, Chinese name is Gong Chang Zhang, I am an Internet experience designer.

62542.name: Design Asset ProductionÔºàDAPÔºâ
62542.description:
Introduction:

Obtain all solid color style data with one click and save it to variables in Figma.

Main functions:

Simple and easy to use: users only need to click the button of the plug-in to complete the query and export of color styles.

Method of use:

  1. Open the Figma document.
  2. Install and run the plug-in (Design Asset Production(DAP)).
  3. Click the "colors style to Variable" button in the plug-in interface.
  4. The plug-in will automatically get the solid color style and add the name and color value to the variable.
  5. The query and export results are saved in variables in the plug-in and are available to the user at any time.

About the Author:

Hello everyone, my English name is Cheung, Chinese name is Gong Chang Zhang, I am an Internet experience designer.

I love‚ù§Figma also uses a large number of plug-ins at ordinary times, but I find that there are always some needs that cannot meet my needs, so I hope to make a plug-in to satisfy myself, and I don't like to switch plug-ins frequently. I hope the plug-in is in a permanent open state to meet my efficient operation.

This is my first time to learn code compilation to develop plug-ins. Maybe plug-ins are relatively simple because I am still learning to develop them.üòÇ, the development progress will be slower, but I believe this plug-in can satisfy more people, welcomeüëèEveryone to use!

I also hope that some developers will help me make more creative functions to reduce the working time of designers and developers.

plugins.name: Follow the Path
plugins.description:
üß≠ FOLLOW THE PATH

A Figma plugin that automatically arranges objects along a vector path with customizable spacing and orientation options.


üéØ FEATURES


üß© Simple Path Selection

  1. Select any vector path to use as a guide for object placement.


üß± Multiple Object Support

  1. Arrange one or many objects along your selected path.


üß† Auto-Detection

  1. The plugin automatically detects both path and objects in your selection.


üìè Flexible Spacing

  1. Auto interval: Distributes objects evenly along the path
  2. Manual interval: Set exact pixel spacing between objects


‚öôÔ∏è Advanced Controls

  1. Rotate objects to follow the path's direction
  2. Measure from center of objects (optional)
  3. Align objects to start, center, or end of path


üßë‚Äçüíª HOW TO USE


  1. Select a vector path, or select both the path and objects
  2. Configure spacing and alignment preferences
  3. Click ‚ÄúDistribute‚Äù to apply


üî¨ TECHNICAL DETAILS

  1. Works with any valid vector path
  2. Optimized for performance with large selections
  3. Smart algorithm for precise placement


üöß BETA NOTICE & KNOWN ISSUES

This is a beta version. Feedback is welcome ‚Äî future updates may follow based on interest and available time.


‚ö†Ô∏è Known issue:

Native Figma shapes (such as ellipses, stars, and polygons) may incorrectly define the starting point of the path after being edited or used in boolean operations. This can lead to inaccurate object placement.


‚úÖ How to fix:

Copy the shape as SVG and paste it back into the canvas ‚Äî this will convert it into a clean vector path.

Additionally, you can manually inspect and adjust the nodes if needed.
plugins.tagline: Arrange objects along any vector path with flexible spacing and rotation options.

125594.name: Follow the Path
125594.description:
üß≠ FOLLOW THE PATH

A Figma plugin that automatically arranges objects along a vector path with customizable spacing and orientation options.


üéØ FEATURES


üß© Simple Path Selection

  1. Select any vector path to use as a guide for object placement.


üß± Multiple Object Support

  1. Arrange one or many objects along your selected path.


üß† Auto-Detection

  1. The plugin automatically detects both path and objects in your selection.


üìè Flexible Spacing

  1. Auto interval: Distributes objects evenly along the path
  2. Manual interval: Set exact pixel spacing between objects


‚öôÔ∏è Advanced Controls

  1. Rotate objects to follow the path's direction
  2. Measure from center of objects (optional)
  3. Align objects to start, center, or end of path


üßë‚Äçüíª HOW TO USE


  1. Select a vector path, or select both the path and objects
  2. Configure spacing and alignment preferences
  3. Click ‚ÄúDistribute‚Äù to apply


üî¨ TECHNICAL DETAILS

  1. Works with any valid vector path
  2. Optimized for performance with large selections
  3. Smart algorithm for precise placement


üöß BETA NOTICE & KNOWN ISSUES

This is a beta version. Feedback is welcome ‚Äî future updates may follow based on interest and available time.


‚ö†Ô∏è Known issue:

Native Figma shapes (such as ellipses, stars, and polygons) may incorrectly define the starting point of the path after being edited or used in boolean operations. This can lead to inaccurate object placement.


‚úÖ How to fix:

Copy the shape as SVG and paste it back into the canvas ‚Äî this will convert it into a clean vector path.

Additionally, you can manually inspect and adjust the nodes if needed.
125594.release_notes:
Fixed an issue with alignment on modified base shapes, ensuring more consistent object placement along the path.

UI interaction has been improved: minor bugs have been resolved, keyboard support has been added, and alignment is now applied automatically after adjusting settings.
125594.tagline: Arrange objects along any vector path with flexible spacing and rotation options.

plugins.name: Icon AI
plugins.description:
IconAI


Create custom icons effortlessly with AI directly in Figma! Enter a prompt, and the plugin generates a unique icon that you can export as an SVG right into your project. Currently free in Beta, this plugin also saves each icon in your history for quick access and reuse.


Future updates will add exciting new features:


  1. Google Login/Signup: Seamlessly access and save your icon history across devices.
  2. Advanced AI: Enjoy even more precise and creative icon generation for your prompts.
  3. Customization Options: Set icon size, color, and quantity to match your design needs.
  4. Image Upload: Upload reference images to guide the AI for even closer matches.
  5. Icon Set Creation: Group icons into cohesive sets for efficient design workflows.
  6. Web Version: Access the plugin from a web interface for an enhanced experience.


Ideal for designers seeking fast, customizable icon generation right within Figma. Take advantage of the free Beta to see how it can transform your workflow!

plugins.name: Word Hugger
plugins.description:
Word Hugger scans all the text elements on the current Figma page, identifying and adjusting paragraphs that end with short, isolated words ‚Äì commonly referred to as "orphans." By converting the space before these orphans into a non-breaking space, the code ensures that these words are not isolated at the end of a paragraph.


In typography, an orphan is a single word at the end of a paragraph. Orphans can disrupt the visual rhythm and balance of a page, making the layout appear uneven and possibly hindering readability. Adjusting them ensures a more aesthetically pleasing and cohesive presentation of text, offering readers a smoother experience.
plugins.tagline: Every word deserves company.

This plugin allows you to get an overview of overrides in your layers.

  3. Selecting layers will navigate to them
  4. The overrides will update periodically if you fix or edit them.
  5. To change selection run the plugin again.

plugins.name: Text Highlighter
plugins.description: Transform text workflow with Text Highlighter! This plugin helps you split large text blocks into separate lines and highlight as you please. While it doesn't directly target individual words, it gets you closer by breaking text at line breaks, giving you more control over your text formatting. Perfect for creating annotated designs, presentations, and documentation where you need to highlight specific lines of text. We're not able to target what we need due to Figma's code restraints, but I think I got us closer to what so many of us are looking for. I'll continue to workshop this, and publish the code on GIT if anyone would like to assist. I hope you enjoy 1.0
plugins.tagline: Text highlighter that targets line breaks!
